public LinearExpression(ArrayList<AtomExpression> elementList,
                        boolean isPositive)
Represents a list of elements that are added up (or substracted) - depending on if parameter isPositive is set to true(+) or not(-).

LinearExpression

public LinearExpression(ArrayList<AtomExpression> positiveList,
                        ArrayList<AtomExpression> negativeList)
E1 + ... + EN - EN+1 - ... - EN+M with N.. length of positiveList and M length of negative list.

Parameters:
positiveList -
negativeList -

LinearExpression

public LinearExpression(ArrayList<AtomExpression> elementList,
                        int operator,
                        AtomExpression result,
                        boolean isPositive,
                        boolean resultIsOnRightSide)
Structure of linear expression:

elementList op result

if resultIsOnRightSide is set to true. If set to false it is

result op elementlist

Please note that operator has to be a relational operator.

Parameters:
elementList -
result -
isPositive -
resultIsOnRightSide -

LinearExpression

public LinearExpression(ArrayList<AtomExpression> positiveList,
                        ArrayList<AtomExpression> negativeList,
                        int operator,
                        AtomExpression result,
                        boolean resultIsOnRightSide)
Linear expression has the structure:

E1 + ... + EN - EN+1 - ... - EN+M operator result

if resultIsOnRightSide is set to true. operator has to be a relational operator ( N.. length of positiveList and M length of negative list)

Parameters:
positiveList -
negativeList -
operator -
result -
resultIsOnRightSide -

public boolean isRelationalLinearExpression()
Returns true, if the linear expression is relational, i.e. of the form
E1 +- E2 +- ... +- En Relop E
